fields.description:
(Based on convo from IRC with jespern)

You should be able to remove yourself from a repositories' access list if you are not the owner. Currently, if you're on any active repos, it's very easy to build up an absolutely huge list of forks, including ones that are already done and won't get touched again.

In addition, the ability to mark a project inactive would be very useful; This would remove it from the repo dropdown, and maybe prevent anybody from pushing to the repo until it is marked active again.

Finally, the repo dropdown should be sorted by something like "following, username asc, reponame asc".
fields.summary: Ability to remove yourself from repositories, inactive repos, and repo dropdown sorting (BB-138)

fields.description:
The current wiki header is very cramped, particularly once you nest pages a few levels deep.

Currently it shows breadcrumb and links top left, and revision info and clone URL in the top right.

Instead, it should have the breadcrumb top left, links top right, cloning info bottom left and revision info bottom right.
fields.summary: Wiki page breadcrumb, navigation, metadata improvements

fields.description: The unlocked lock in the repositories drop down menu is not transparent.  It has a white square to it.  This is different from the locked state which doesn't have the white square on the image.
fields.summary: Locks are not transparent in Repositories drop down menu

fields.description: So people won't have to use the 'hg' username. Would be cool.
fields.summary: Investigate a PAM module for allowing arbitrary SSH auth

fields.description: Your copyrights need to be updated

{{{\\
% file Home.wiki\\
Home.wiki: UTF-8 Unicode (with BOM) English text\\
}}}\\
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Byte-order_mark

The first three bytes are EF BB BF.  This is why the markup on the first line is ignored.   I have yet to figure out how to make any text editor rip off the BOM header, they all faithfully replace it.

This exposed some bugs in TortoiseHg (which I guess I'm thankful for), as it causes decoding errors when converting the text to ascii.

E.g. remove the badge and use an "Inbox"-link/-icon in the main nav instead.

Make the existence of the avatar-dropdowns more obvious.
fields.summary: Make notifications more visible in the ui

fields.description: Otherwise it's a pain to scroll up each time you reach the end of the page. To me, pagination is not that important (I never use it, except when I'm back from holidays) so it should be moved to the bottom and not duplicated.
fields.summary: Put the newsfeed pagination at the bottom (or duplicate it?) on homepage

fields.description: It will ease the way to send a link to a particular line of code.
fields.summary: Make linenumbers in source-view link to #cl-xx anchor

fields.description: The nice lock icons used for "Your repositories" on the homepage should replace the blue lock icons currently used on the repo Overview page.
fields.summary: use new lock icon on repo pages

fields.description: An admin should be able to delete a comment on an issue.
Browsers will grab the filename from the URL.
fields.summary: Content-disposition for raw files should not include filename

fields.description: Please provide an about page since it's kinda weird to pay for a service not knowing the recipient. I think some people might find that daunting.

It is not immediately obvious how you get to the changeset from the changesets page. The message area should be clickable, much like the message is clickable on the overview page.

That, or the commit / parent links on the right-hand side should be made more obvious; At the moment the underline on parent commit gives more focus than the link to the actual changeset itself.

Also, the title calls it "changelog," while every other instance calls it "changesets."
fields.summary: Message area for changesets on the changesets page should be clickable

I'd like to write an app that will pull open issues assigned to me in a given issue tracker and push them into a task list on rememberthemilk.com.

Could you please remove issues from 44 to 55 on tuentifox project?

Thanks.

Example:  When I uploaded the picture set for my avatar I did not have a copy of a good picture for myself to use. The drop down in the inbox (to mark messages read, etc) seems unnecessary, why not just 3 buttons, one for each action?

This is a big problem to our developers, because we created a dns alias to have a more user friendly url and now we get this page:

Static

fields.description:
This is a rant.

You have screenshots of your website's webpages on your website. The pages themselves, I bet, are smaller in size than the png's could ever be.

Just make a couple of static pages. If you need buttons they can just do nothing, etc etc. Compare bandwidth saved.

You also do not have a component for the website itself.

PS: I like bitbucket.

fields.description:
The BitBucket interface for comparing changesets is quite nice, in my opinion. It would be nice to be able to use it for reviewing the changes between my branch and upstream. Especially if the changes still looked good on print.

As I said in my previous report; thank you for providing an excellent service and happy holidays to you all!
fields.summary: Allow comparison of arbitrary changesets, branches or tags (BB-529)

fields.description:
If you use a naming convention where branches and tags are grouped using the standard directory separator, slash or '/', they cannot be linked to by their name, but must be linked to using the hexadecimal checksum identifier.

On a slightly related note, it would be nice if those groupings where combined to a hierarchy in the web UI. I use BitBucket for hosting full-history mirrors of some LLVM repositories, and the numerous Apple version tags clutter the list.

Other than those minor issues, I must say that I find your services to be excellent and very reasonably priced. Thank you, and I hope you enjoy the holidays!
fields.summary: Branches and tags with slashes in their name (BB-527)

fields.description:
On weblocks-dev, the append-only semantics are naturally good.  Mainline development and stable branches should only proceed in one direction.

However, some Weblocks hackers would like to manage topic branches, such as weblocks-nav4, on top of dev's tip.  So that when weblocks-dev grows, they use hg 1.1's new rebase to move the topic branch content ahead.

However, with append-only, this will only succeed in creating a new head and a bunch of "duplicate" revisions.
fields.summary: Repo option: divergent push strips "defunct" revisions

fields.description: When you search from a URL like http://www.bitbucket.org/repo/all/7/ it won't work (from from /1/ it will).
In the summary page there's the list of files added/modified/deleted.  It has lots of zeros, which are boring.  Blank spaces would be better.

From time to time users send me links to external repositories so that I can pull some patches.  These however are not listed in the forks/queues tab for obvious reasons.

It would be nice if users can register external forks there so that these "don't get lost".
The "Create new issue" screen should have the same 'preview' functionality that the issue commenting screen does.

http://github.com/blog/270-the-fork-queue\\

On public repos' issue trackers the:

* owner
* repo name
* homepage
* description
* icon\\
are all shown.

In contrast, on private repos' public issue trackers, only the "Repo is private" warning is given, and *all* info about the project is excluded. I think not displaying identifying info is part of what's causing the BB tracker to accidentally get bug reports intended for other projects. Perhaps this should be changed?
fields.summary: Private repos w/ public trackers should still include identification

hg@bitbucket.org "hg -R evgeniysharapov/conf-emacs/ serve --stdio""\\

}}}

fields.description:
At the moment the only way to get updates on actions taken in project issue tracker is through global newsfeed, which is populated from all projects you're following (no matter how much you actually care). Situation with wiki edits is even worse since you can't see notifications anywhere, except last revision date and single page history (there is no global wiki history).

Since way how "Overview" page is called, it would be nice to have actual overview on all project related actions - not only source code.

It would be pretty swank to see some more social aspects added to bb, helping me find interesting and active projects more easily.
Allow users to include a per. user and or per. repository google analytics account, which will receive updates.

has git-stuff, proper parent detection, and tracks renames, I'm told. should not be a big deal to switch out.
fields.summary: Pluck out mdiff.unidiff from our differ and use patch.diff in its place (BB-524)

fields.description:
sphinx has gained wide acceptance as the standard documentation tool for open source python projects. Sphinx just uses text files with a restructured text syntax as source files.

It would be great if bitbucket wiki feature could be able to edit a folder of restructured text files otherwise rendered as a sphinx static site while being wiki editable through the bitbucket web UI or the hg text access.
fields.summary: Add restructured text support to wikify an existing sphinx documentation (BB-523)

fields.description: when using openid, deleting a repository seems impossible as it asks the password. which bitbucket should not have (and does not have?).
could one clone a foreign repository hosted somewhere else?
Or even allow Wiki markup?
Suggested in a comment on http://blog.bitbucket.org/b/2008/11/tips-tricks-5-dont-like-the-default-code-highlight/
fields.summary: Code highlight style should be per user, not per repo (BB-522)

fields.description:
Here's some output from a push:

$ hg push\\
pushing to https://groks@bitbucket.org/naviserver/nsdbilite\\
real URL is http://bitbucket.org/naviserver/nsdbilite/\\
...

Notice that the 's' was dropped from 'https' at the start. hg asks for my password and the push succeeds.

I didn't try sniffing, but does this mean my password was sent in the clear?

Two bugs here: one is mercurial's -- it shouldn't switch from ssl to non-ssl when sending a password without complaining loudly. The other is bitbucket's -- need to be careful not to drop the https protocol when redirecting.
fields.summary: redirects from secure https to http when pushing

fields.description:
It would be very useful to have an open tickets count on the Repositories page (http://www.bitbucket.org/Bounga/) near the repository name.

With this feature, we'll be able to see in one second how many tickets are open (new / open) for a given project and jump to it to see what are the open tickets.

Someone has the question 'what has changed since the last release'?

You can get a list of changes, like this:

bitbucket.org/aolserver/aolserver/changesets/

By default it doesn't show very many, but after clicking 'more' a couple of times, you get to here:

bitbucket.org/aolserver/aolserver/changesets/1/60/

The tag aolserver-4.5.0 is about 3/4 down the page.

What I would like is the ability to pass the questioner a link like this:

bitbucket.org/aolserver/aolserver/changesets/tip/aolserver-4.5.0/

To show exactly what has changed during the period of interest.

At the moment, it seems like I would have to count down (or backwards, up) the page to figure out the offset.

In addition, if it accepts tags then it should also accept ids and hashes. Unfortunately, I think this clashes with your current syntax where a numeric ID, such as 1491 in the case above, would be confused as an offset, and 1491 changesets on one page is waaay too many.

So how about this additional syntax:

bitbucket.org/aolserver/aolserver/changesets/tip:1491/

ie. if the single changeset specification contains a colon, then it is treated as the '-r' flag is by hg itself.

In fact, you might want to drop the existing URL syntax altogether. That is, when the user clicks 'more', instead of increasing the offset by 20, decrement the id by 20 and by default construct URLs like the above.
fields.summary: changelog: accept tags in ranges as well as numeric offsets
